text: to make dulce de leche you take regular
milk and a lot of sugar and then you
cook it down until it's rich and
caramelized I used coconut milk to make
an intensely flavored version that
happens to be dairy-free so I've got my
coconut milk and I'm using a wide
skillet that way it cooks down a little
bit more quickly and then over here I've
got some dark brown sugar this helps
give it a really nice dark caramelized
look the thing about making dulce de
leche it's super easy you just need to
have a lot of time on your hands because
once I start simmering this it could
take anywhere from an hour to even three
or four hours depending on your stove
so this is what it looks like when it's
about halfway done
you can see that the color is starting
to darken it's getting a little bit
thicker but it's still got a long way to
go and then this is what it looks like
when it's all done you can see that it's
thick and brown it coats the spoon and
just remember that it's gonna thicken up
more as it cools so take it off the heat
now I have an entire pineapple that's
been cored obviously peeled and then cut
up into little chunks and over here I
have just some more brown sugar I'm just
gonna toss just a little bit with the
pineapple pineapples pretty sweet so it
doesn't need a lot of sugar and then I'm
gonna let this sit so that the sugar
melts just takes a couple of minutes you
can use a whole pineapple or you know
what I usually do is I buy the pre-cut
pineapple in the little packages because
usually those are the ripeness and then
I'm gonna broil it nice okay this is
good you should make the coconut dulce
de leche at least a couple of hours
ahead that way it has a chance to sit in
the fridge and firm up and have a nice
texture however the pineapple needs to
be done within an hour of serving
because otherwise it's gonna sit and
then all the nice caramelization is just
kind of kind of drip right off so you
can see how nice and thick it got after
sitting in the fridge it's like putting
and you really don't need a lot of this
stuff it's super rich so just a little
bit in the bottom of your serving dish
here then I'm gonna add my pineapple I'm
gonna add some toasted coconut chips now
if I had toasted salted macadamia nuts
those would be amazing right on top of
this it would be crunchy and make it
even more tropical but I don't so I'm
gonna add my favorite dessert topping
instead can you guess what it is just a
little bit of fleur de sel
